SimilarGroups.SimilarityNote: All requirements emphasize compliance with privacy regulations, user control over data, and secure data handling.
SimilarGroups.DifferenceNote: Some requirements focus on specific regulations (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR), while others are more general. Some are functional (e.g., interface design), while others are non-functional (e.g., data handling protocols).

UnifiedRequirement.Name: Comprehensive Privacy and Data Security
UnifiedRequirement.Description: The system shall provide a clear and intuitive interface for users to customize privacy settings, ensure all data collection and sharing comply with privacy regulations (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR), and implement robust security protocols, including data encryption and secure data handling.

SimilarGroups.SimilarityNote: Both requirements focus on providing secure communication channels for healthcare-related interactions.
SimilarGroups.DifferenceNote: P-006-FR-003 emphasizes caregivers interacting with clients' family members and healthcare providers, while P-004-FR-002 focuses on Mike coordinating with patients and other healthcare providers.

UnifiedRequirement.Name: Secure Healthcare Communication
UnifiedRequirement.Description: The system must provide secure and encrypted communication channels for caregivers, patients, and healthcare providers to interact, ensuring privacy and confidentiality.

SimilarGroups.SimilarityNote: Both requirements focus on ensuring compliance and preventing unauthorized data access.
SimilarGroups.DifferenceNote: P-003-FR-003 emphasizes maintaining an audit trail for data access and changes, while P-003-NFR-002 focuses on enforcing strict access control mechanisms.

UnifiedRequirement.Name: Compliance and Access Control
UnifiedRequirement.Description: The system must maintain a detailed audit trail of all user and system interactions, including data access and changes to privacy settings, and enforce strict access control mechanisms to ensure compliance and prevent unauthorized data access.

Conflicts.Note: P-007-FR-004 emphasizes a user-friendly interface for privacy settings, while P-003-NFR-002 prioritizes strict access control, which may complicate the user experience.

P-006-FR-003 focuses on caregivers interacting with clients' family members and healthcare providers, while P-004-FR-002 focuses on Mike coordinating with patients and other healthcare providers, potentially leading to different communication channel designs.
